byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein, Ashley Southall and Nikita Stewart contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ELI ROSENBERG and NATE SCHWEBER

abstract: Emergency workers take 33 people suspected of overdosing on synthetic marijuana, known as K2, from area on border of Brooklyn's Bedford-Stuyvesant and Bushwick neighborhoods to hospitals; incident underscores growing threat posed by drug, particularly among homeless populations.
lead_paragraph: On the border of Bedford-Stuyvesant and Bushwick, a longstanding problem became a local crisis. “It’s like a scene out of a zombie movie,” one resident said.

headline.main: 33 Suspected of Overdosing on Synthetic Marijuana in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: 33 Suspected of Overdosing on Synthetic Marijuana
